page.title: 07QUORN HALL AND GROUNDS
page.content: {Quorn Hall}was built in 1430 for Mr.Farnham. Later it was the home of Mr. Hugo Meynell Master of{Quorn Hunt. Now it belongs to Leicester County Council and is used as an {International Education Centre}which opened in 1978 for children who come from Italy, Germany, France and England. They stay for about a week and go to places of interest like London, York, Coventry and Leicester. Sometimes they go to more local places like Loughborough. In good weather the children go swimming or boating on the river which runs through the grounds that cover 2-3 acres. Quorn Hall has two dining rooms. One can hold sixty people and the other, the Farnham room, can hold forty-two people. There is supposed to be a ghost of a woman murdered by her husband in Quorn Hall. {MICHELLE BEAUMONT
